Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Rumenitin-R (Leu-rich; natural AMPs; Mastoparan, UCLL1, insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (81.25%) toEumenitinL: 33%, K: 20%, N: 13%.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 60 uM), S. epidermidis clinical sample (MIC 30 uM), M. luteus ATCC 10240 (MIC 15 uM), S. pyogenes clinical sample (MIC 15 uM), B. subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC 7.5 uM), Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 30 uM), P. mirabilis clinical sample (MIC 60 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 30 uM), S. maltophilia ATCC 13637 (MIC 15 uM), yeast C. albicans ATCC 90112 (MIC <7.5 uM),Structure:  random coil in tris buffer and helical in 8 mM SDS, 40% TFE, or 250 asolectin (lipids).
Literature Information.Author: Rangel M, Cabrera MP, Kazuma K, Ando K, Wang X, Kato M, Nihei K, Hirata IY, Cross TJ, Garcia AN, Faquim-Mauro EL, Franzolin MR, Fuchino H, Mori-Yasumoto K, Sekita S, Kadowaki M, Satake M, Konno K. 2011
Literature Information.Title: Chemical and biological characterization of four new linear cationic alpha-helical peptides from the venoms of two solitary eumenine wasps.
